name: Motherboard
about: The motherboard is the main board that is screwed directly inside the computer case.

name: Central processing unit
about: The CPU or central processing unit is basically like the brain of computer systems. It processes all the information on a computational level.

name: Graphics processing unit
about: A graphics card is an output device that processes the data from the motherboard and sends the appropriate information to the computer’s screen for display.

name: Random access memory
about: RAM or random access memory is a data storage device that can provide fast read and write access. RAM is volatile memory, meaning it loses all the stored data when power is lost.

name: Hard disk
about: A hard drive is still found in most computers to this day. It’s usually a mechanical drive that stores all the data.

name: Sound Card
about: Most of the time, the sound chip built into the motherboard is used for audio output.

name: Solid State Drive
about: An SSD is also a type of hard drive, but it doesn’t have any moving parts. It consists of a bank of flash memory that can hold a reasonable amount of data.

name: Power Supply Unit
about: This converts the AC mains supply from the power cord from a wall socket and supplies the correct DC voltages to all the components inside the computer.
